meanings.definition: The skill of clear and expressive speech, especially in public speaking.
meanings.sent1: Her elocution during the debate captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's elocution made it easy for the students to understand the lesson.
meanings.sent3: His elocution was so impressive that even the shyest student felt confident to speak up.
meanings.sent4: The elocution of the news anchor was like music to the ears of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The elocution of the actor brought the character to life on stage.

meanings.definition: The act of speaking or reading in a clear and expressive manner.
meanings.sent1: The elocution of the storyteller kept the children engaged till the end.
meanings.sent2: She practiced her elocution every day to improve her communication skills.
meanings.sent3: The elocution of the auctioneer made even the dullest items sound exciting.
meanings.sent4: His elocution was like a gentle breeze, soothing to the ears of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The elocution of the poet painted vivid images in the minds of the audience.
